Reference attachments for examples of what I\'m talking about

Set symmetry to 4x, and place them like you would a radial decoupler. If you need more than one set, it can start to look ugly at the seams, but there isn\'t an awful lot you can do about it.

The nose cone panels attach to the top of the side panels when set to 4x symmetry.
That\'s for Wobbly Rockets and Silisko Edition\'s PLFs, CaptainSlug\'s PLF set and the Challenger Pack use half-piece fairings, so they use 2x symmetry.
Each PLF sets have their own ways of assembly.

I decided to go back to these because I got tired of shooting for the moon, decided to do some circular orbits and a couple of sats. The way I did it is that I used the nose cone and then connected the other pieces to it but that didn\'t work too well because the nose none didn\'t detach properly.

From the screenshots it looks like they\'re attached to the end of the fuel tanks. I\'ll have to see if that\'s exactly how they work since I haven\'t used them in a while.

Edit: Ah. They behave like radial decouplers, just move them around near the end of the fuel tank you intend to attach them to until they meet with each other.
